Jun 11 - AMP Capital and 3i Infrastructure are considering a possible sale of their Esvagt offshore energy infrastructure service vessel business and are said to be looking at hiring advisers. 3i Infrastructure has its 50% stake valued at £189m in March up from £141m the year before, mainly due to increased investment.

The fund said "higher-than-expected utilisation in the offshore wind market was offset by ERRV demand being lower in the first half of the year than had been forecast. We lowered the discount rate to reflect improved visibility in the emergency response and rescue vessel (ERRV) segment and the increased share of long-term, contracted schedule of values (SOV) cashflows in the business." 

In early 2018 the two put in place a €376m refinancing on the asset via RBC and NatWest split between bank debt and an institutional tranche. The DKr2bn of bank debt, €268m, runs for five years and is priced at 275bp to year three, 300bp in year four and 350bp in year five. 3i Infrastructure is selling its Oystercatcher oil terminals company, which holds 45% of Oiltanking. Macquarie Capital is advising.  

(Rod Morrison)
